header: Python compiled .so modules, to link in custom python.km
Describes metadata needed to build KM specific libs
Status can be unknown, fail, built or validated. Undefined status is unknown.  Built means link succeded but we did not run the actual code. Warnin
For versions, defauld is the last one in array (versions[-1])
For dependencies, tools means exec should be there - eventually we will convert it to dnf or modules

modules.name: numpy
modules.abstract: The fundamental package for scientific computing with Python. - numpy/numpy.
modules.comment: NOTE: if atlas (Automatically Tuned Linear Algebra Software) is installed (with atlas-static), numpy picks it up and expect static libtatlas.a which is not avail in dnf (only libatlas.a is there)

modules.name: gunicorn
modules.abstract: gunicorn 'Green Unicorn' is a WSGI HTTP Server for UNIX, fast clients and sleepy applications. - benoitc/gunicorn.

modules.name: wrapt
modules.abstract: A Python module for decorators, wrappers and monkey patching.

modules.name: autowrapt
modules.abstract: Boostrap mechanism for monkey patches. Contribute to GrahamDumpleton/autowrapt development by creating an account on GitHub

modules.name: Pillow
modules.abstract: The friendly PIL fork (Python Imaging Library). Contribute to python-pillow/Pillow development by creating an account on GitHub.
modules.comment: Builds but needs libjpeg.a and libfreestyle.a and they are not in dnf. Installation instructions: https://pillow.readthedocs.io/en/latest/installation.htm

modules.name: nameko
modules.abstract: Python framework for building microservices. Contribute to nameko/nameko development by creating an account on GitHub.

dependsOn.modules: werkzeug  requests  mock  kombu  eventlet  wrapt  six  pyyaml  path.py

modules.name: protobuf
modules.abstract: Protocol Buffers - Google's data interchange format
modules.comment: ^^^^ uses redirection to 'pth' mechanism - file cpython/Lib/protobuf-3.10.0-py3.7-nspkg.pth defines the code below.#      needs investigation, uses this: # import sys, types, os;has_mfs = sys.version_info > (3, 5);p = os.path.join(sys._getframe(1).f_locals['sitedir' ], *('google',));importlib = has_mfs and __import__('importlib.util');has_mfs and __import__('importlib.machinery');m = has_mfs and sys.modules.setdefault('google', importlib.util.module_from_spec(importlib.machinery.PathFinder.find_spec('google',[os.path.dirname(p)])));m = m or sys.modules.setdefault('google', types.ModuleType('google'));mp = (m or []) and m.__dict__.setdefault('__path__',[]);(p not in mp) and mp.append(p)
